physical_environment.description: Physical and architectural structure of the scene.

social_environment.description: Perceived social formality of the setting.

social_roles.description: Social roles inferred from posture, attire, or positioning.

social_hierarchy.description: Postural or spatial indicators of dominance or submission.

cardinality.description: Visible number of social participants engaged in the interaction, inferred from body orientation, proximity, and gaze within the cameraâ€™s field of view.

interaction_type.description: Goal or orientation of the visible interaction.

communication_mode.description: Mode of social influence or exchange observed.

interdependence_level.description: Visible arrangement of bodies and orientations (proxemic distance and mutual orientation/gaze cues).

emotional_valence.description: Overall emotional tone of the interaction as visible from expressions, posture, and gestures.

scenario_category.description: Pre-defined environment templates determined by the combination of physical_environment and social_environment. These guide visual diversity while remaining consistent with the contextual frame.

background_population.description: Presence of unrelated people in the background of the scene.

background_demography.description: Apparent demographic profile of background people only (not the main actors).

age_group.description: Visible age category of the main subject(s) in the interaction.
